channel.title: A form game! very hard encryption i doubt any one will get it
channel.description:
hi all ive made a encryption program with some help =] and now i want to test my encryption so ive made a link some were and ive encrypted that link so if you can un encrypt it go to the link get what's at that link open it and post it here ;]
[code] ><,.:~#':~#'!)_+>;@]#;']#>,,']#>,,^$&&@&^'!)_+$%;:@:_ú>>,@><,.@&^'^$&&}?!> &1'@#ú&%ú*?@{*(%/?']#>,,&*ú@$%;:%ú*;}?!>>>,@']#>,,!%^;'[!%^^^!@:{}:>@@;$&!@:{}:> !%^!^$!%^^^!']#>,,@:_ú?@{**^<;??^&%ú*;?@{*@&^'@:_ú(%/?}?!>&1'@#ú^$&&@&^'^$&&&1'@ #ú><,.:~#'(%/?%ú*;`¼/'*)$;'*^$ [/code]
this is a very easy one if you are stuck on the top one it is a one word encryption no spaces or .:/ also that is the only symbols in the top encryption. here is the easy one [code] >>,@$%;:(%/?!)_+%ú*;}?!>`¼/'*)$;'*^$ [/code]
goodluck!
competition open for 10 days.
[center]9 days left[/center]

item.title: A form game! very hard encryption i doubt any one will get it
item.dc:creator: @N00b1 N00b1
item.description:
@N00b1 wrote:

[quote=“oddinn686, post:32, topic:42316”]OK, I’m board. See if you guys can figure out the rest.
Numbers in parentheses are patters that I haven’t given a letter yet. If something is marked - once, that means that the pattern only shows up once in the given code.
I’m 99% of what I’ve got so far, excluding the “e”.

<,. = h
:~#’ = t
:~#’ = t
!)+ = p
;@]#; = : (colon)
']#>, = /
‘]#>, = /
^$&& = (1)
@&^’ = (2)
!)+ = p
$%;: = (3)
@:_ú = (4)

,@ = (5)
<,. = h
@&^’ = (2)
^$&& = (1)
}?!> = e (6)
&1’@#ú = . (dot)
&%ú* = c
?@{* = o
(%/? = m
']#>, = /
&ú@ = (7) - once
$%;: = (3)
%ú; = l
}?!> = e (6)

,@ = (5)
‘]#>, = /
!%^ = (8)
;’[ = (9) - once
!%^ = (8)
^^! = (10)
@:{}:> = (11)
@@;$&! = (12) - once
@:{}:> = (11)
!%^ = (8)
!^$ = (13) - once
!%^ = (8)
^^! = (10)
‘]#>, = /
@:_ú = (4)
?@{* = o
^<; = w
??^& = (14) - once
%ú; = l
?@{* = o
@&^’ = (2)
@:_ú = (4)
(%/? = m
}?!> = e (6)
&1’@#ú = . (dot)
^$&& = (1)
@&^’ = (2)
^$&& = (1)
&1’@#ú = . (dot)
<,. = h
:~#’ = t
(%/? = m
%ú*; = l
`¼/’)$;’^$ = crap that goes at the end of every word

12p345h21e.com 10 letters + .com
(7)3le5 5 letters
8(9)81011(12)118(13)810 11 letters
4ow(14)lo24me 10 letters
121 3 letters

And here’s the example word that was given.

,@ = (5)
$%;: = (3)
(%/? = m
!)_+ = p
%ú*; = l
}?!> = e (6)
`¼/’)$;’^$ = nothing

Uh~vA#Qrpq'woh'pvshupv{klelv{1jrt#vimljlho'LYF'foduqlo'dug'whor#lylu€evg€/'wv#shhuu#or~#{r'fsljn'klul

This time, no hint.

The variance is -7, -3. Sorry, but I’m too lazy to figure out the rest.

Looks like no one can figure mine out? I’ll give a hint: The first four letters are ‘News’. And yes, there is a variance pattern.[/quote]

close verry close[quote=“Zorlin, post:33, topic:42316”]By the way:

N00b1:

check out my form @…: http://imbored.freehostia.com/index.php

Its spelled FORUM not FORM.[/quote]

woopsie

Read full topic

item.description:
@oddinn686 wrote:

OK, I’m board. See if you guys can figure out the rest.
Numbers in parentheses are patters that I haven’t given a letter yet. If something is marked - once, that means that the pattern only shows up once in the given code.
I’m 99% of what I’ve got so far, excluding the “e”.

><,. = h :~#' = t :~#' = t !)_+ = p >;@]#; = : (colon) ']#>,, = / ']#>,, = / ^$&& = (1) @&^' = (2) !)_+ = p $%;: = (3) @:_ú = (4) >>,@ = (5) ><,. = h @&^' = (2) ^$&& = (1) }?!> = e (6) &1'@#ú = . (dot) &%ú* = c ?@{* = o (%/? = m ']#>,, = / &*ú@ = (7) - once $%;: = (3) %ú*; = l }?!> = e (6) >>,@ = (5) ']#>,, = / !%^ = (8) ;'[ = (9) - once !%^ = (8) ^^! = (10) @:{}:> = (11) @@;$&! = (12) - once @:{}:> = (11) !%^ = (8) !^$ = (13) - once !%^ = (8) ^^! = (10) ']#>,, = / @:_ú = (4) ?@{* = o *^<; = w ??^& = (14) - once %ú*; = l ?@{* = o @&^' = (2) @:_ú = (4) (%/? = m }?!> = e (6) &1'@#ú = . (dot) ^$&& = (1) @&^' = (2) ^$&& = (1) &1'@#ú = . (dot) ><,. = h :~#' = t (%/? = m %ú*; = l `¼/'*)$;'*^$ = crap that goes at the end of every word

12p345h21e.com 10 letters + .com
(7)3le5 5 letters
8(9)81011(12)118(13)810 11 letters
4ow(14)lo24me 10 letters
121 3 letters

And here’s the example word that was given.

>>,@ = (5) $%;: = (3) (%/? = m !)_+ = p %ú*; = l }?!> = e (6) `¼/'*)$;'*^$ = nothing

[quote=“Weibs, post:28, topic:42316”][quote author=Weibs link=topic=59141.msg723822#msg723822 date=1167740327]

Uh~vA#Qrpq'woh'pvshupv{klelv{1jrt#vimljlho'LYF'foduqlo'dug'whor#lylu€evg€/'wv#shhuu#or~#{r'fsljn'klul

This time, no hint.
[/quote][/quote]
The variance is -7, -3. Sorry, but I’m too lazy to figure out the rest.

Looks like no one can figure mine out? I’ll give a hint: The first four letters are ‘News’. And yes, there is a variance pattern.

item.dc:creator: @PaulT PaulT
item.description:
@PaulT wrote:

I tried it for about 20 minutes already. Using that inductive shit.

You also have to guess some of the letters by the frequency they appear (for example, E is the most common letter, some letters are more likely to be at the start or end of words, etc.).

item.title: A form game! very hard encryption i doubt any one will get it
item.dc:creator: @PaulT PaulT
item.description:
@PaulT wrote:

I would solve it letter frequency and then simple inductive reasoning.

Any cypher can be solved in this way, provided each letter only has one corresponding number.

Read full topic
item.source: A form game! very hard encryption i doubt any one will get it

item.title: A form game! very hard encryption i doubt any one will get it
item.dc:creator: @White_Castle White Castle
item.description:
@White_Castle wrote:

If this is based on this thread by any chance, this isn’t encryption at all but more like Erratic Character Replacement. There’s no way to solve this unless there’s some pattern somewhere.

" " is “h”, variance of 72 decimals based on your standard ASCII table.
“>” is “t”, variance of 54.
“,” is “p”, variance of 68.

I don’t see any apparent pattern there ;P.

Read full topic
